fields.title: Web Application Operations Engineer
fields.description:

You will have a keen understanding of the entire LAMP stack.

* Understand website and application capacity planning requirements

fields.title: Director of Product Marketing
fields.description:
This position is based in San Francisco, CA or Mountain View, CA.

Reports to the Chief Marketing Officer

Mozilla is a global non-profit dedicated to putting the user in control of their online experience and shaping the future of the Web for the public good.  Our purpose, our passion and our global community of dedicated paid and volunteer staff allow us to compete head-to-head with some of the world's largest technology companies.

This is a place like no other, and we attract those who want to make a positive difference in the world. If you've been looking for an opportunity to build and lead a team that's on the front lines, fighting for the public good and driving a hard hitting product marketing program for a global product line with more than 450 million users, then this is an opportunity you should explore.

In this role, you will be responsible for building and leading all aspects of our product marketing function as a senior strategist and operational leader.

Primary Responsibilities:
* Core messaging, positioning and market strategies for new and existing products
* Creating and leading execution of targeted consumer marketing campaigns to acquire new customers for all current and future product offerings globally
* Being the voice for current and potential users, working closely with product management to refine product specifications in order to meet market demand

Desired Personal Characteristics:
* Highly creative and innovative thinker willing to take risks
* Results driven leader comfortable working in a fast paced environment and able to make informed decisions under pressure
* Hands on individual who encourages collaboration and teamwork and is consistently seen as a team player, willing to take on lower level work in any circumstance
* Strong character, ethics, and a high standard of performance

Desired Skills & Experience:
* Minimum of 8 years strategic marketing experience. Global experience strongly preferred.
* Bachelor's degree in marketing, engineering or related field; Master's degree preferred.
* Experience with a major Internet or other consumer technology brand
* Thorough understanding of the consumer Internet space including hardware/device and software/apps trends
* Extensive experience in marketing campaign design, execution and measurement
* Marketing experience with website optimization and engagement
* Exceptional writing, interpersonal communication, attention to detail and advanced presentation skills
* Ability to proactively communicate with and manage direct reports and cross-functional distributed teams across multiple time zones

fields.title: Web Application Security Engineer
fields.description:
We're looking for an exceptional Web Application Security Engineer to be part of the Security Team who's sole mission is to make sure Mozilla's environment is secure and safe for 450+ million users. Our gear serves updates, products, add-ons and services to over ~25% of the web and with that high profile comes constant risk of malicious attacks. This position will require coordinations between many aspects of security with a focus on vulnerability management, incident response, and event aggregation and correlation.

This individual will be a highly motivated security professional who understands vulnerability analysis and is able to perform assessments for large and complex web environment. The ideal candidate will understand common web vulnerabilities, read code, and recommend solutions.

Responsibilities:
* Perform web application assessments for php, python, and cgi environments
* Coordinate external and internal security scanning efforts
* Evaluate findings and qualify issues in order to determine true security impact
* Coordinate remediation efforts for qualified findings with various groups within the company
* Monitor real time security logging applications for anomalies within the environment
* Provide code reviews and expertice for deployments of new systems architecture, web sites and database architectures

Requirements:
* Demonstrated experience with finding common web site security issues (XSS, CSRF, session fixation, SQL injection, information leakage, etc.)
* Knowledge in software development Linux and database environments including MySQL and PostgreSQL
* Strong Linux/Unix background with scripting abilities
* Understand web application attack vectors and how to exploit/correct them
* Solid understanding of web application counter-measures
* Must provide remediation methods and suggest action based on vulnerability reporting
* Working knowledge of crypto (SSL certificates, code signing, symmetric crypto) desirable

Mozilla deals with large volumes of data and transforming it into a data warehouse requires cutting edge skills, creative thinking and disciplined engineering.  Because we are committed to the open source community, this position will provide a unique opportunity to work on ways to use data for the good of all Internet users not just a proprietary few.

* Expertise with ETL -- experience with processing data from web log files, databases, and webservices is important

ElasticSearch a big plus

fields.description:
Users are at the heart of the Mozilla mission and we strive to understand their behaviors, attitudes and emotions to help improve the products and services we create. The Data Analyst for user experience is a critical driving force behind gathering structured user insights and then leveraging these insights to inspire and inform design.

We are looking for people who can use analytical skills to find ways to improve the user experience of Mozilla products.  This role will identify user behavior patterns, trouble spots, develop success metrics and chart the impact of changes.

The candidate should have a history of working with large scale quantitative data sets, live experiments or other methods that help data-driven user research scale to meet the needs of millions of users. Required skills include knowledge of programming languages related to data analysis (e.g. Python, R), an understanding of how Mozilla products are instrumented, and/or web development  (e.g. HTML,  CSS, Java Script). Other technical specialties might include the creation of visual dashboards to understand trends, experience in working with SQL databases, or other experience related to online experiments (e.g. A/B testing, live testing, context-sensitive survey techniques). More important than knowledge of any specific technology,  the User Experience Data Analyst should have a strong, well developed interest in using large-scale  research techniques to understand users of digital products and services.

Responsibilities:
* Work with designers, engineers and product team to help define user experience goals and metrics
* Identify and analyze quantitative measures of user experience
* Help drive change by communicating insights to stakeholders in the company

Requirements:
* Advanced Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science,  Human-Computer Interaction, Statistics, Psychology or a related field
* A track record demonstrating excellent command of the research questions in the analysis of user experience problems, and of the technical tools related to those questions
* Excellent working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design
* Experience in open source projects is a big plus

fields.title: College: 2012 Intern - Research Engineering (MS and PhD levels)
fields.description:
Mozilla is looking for outstanding Masters and PhD level interns to tackle various projects within our Research Group.  Past interns have done substantial work in Language Design, Compiler Optimizations and/or Static/Dynamic Analysis. That said, your work will be highly visible and fully Open, just like the rest of Mozilla. We've put together a list of possible research topics for this particular term, but we'd love it if you have research ideas of your own to bring to the group.  As always, we strongly encourage our research interns to submit their results to relevant academic conferences. To apply, submit your resume via the online form located below.  Be sure to add a line or two a the top of your CV indicating what area of research is most interesting and we'll be back in touch to schedule phone interviews directly. We have limited number of openings so please reach out early if you are interested.
 
Project 1: Offline JavaScript Performance Analysis
Modern JavaScript engines make assumptions about the style of code they expect to see. They often assume code is “well-structured” and "well-typed" according to a latent static type system. It can be difficult for programmers to predict whether their code violates the expectations made by optimizing engines. This project would be to develop an offline JavaScript analysis tool that can inform web developers when their programs are likely to fall off the optimized paths of modern engines.
 
Project 2: Hygienic Macros for JavaScript
JavaScript standardization is a slow process, and the language only acquires new features every 5 to 10 years. At the same time, the demand for new features from developers is great enough that (http://altjs.org) new languages that compile to JavaScript are constantly being developed. If JavaScript supported macros, programmers could invent new language constructs with new syntax and share them as libraries. This project would be to design and prototype a hygienic macro system for JavaScript.
 
Project 3: Parallel HTML Parser
Browsers do not currently take advantage of hardware parallelism as much as they could. The parsing algorithms in Firefox are currently entirely sequential. This project would be to design and implement a parallel HTML parser.
 
Project 4: Parallel CSS Processing
There are many opportunities for parallel processing of CSS. This project would be to parallelize CSS selector matching and rule processing.
 
Project 5: Power-efficient Video Decoding
Firefox ships with video decoders written for the CPU, using SIMD extensions where available. These decoders are known to have poor power consumption. This project would be to implement a tuned video decoder using programmable GPU's via OpenGL and to compare the performance and power consumption against that of tuned CPU+SIMD decoders and hardware-specialized decoders.
 
Project 6:Power-efficient Voice Recognition
Many accessibility systems use voice recognition as a primary user input mechanism, and voice recognition is becoming more prevalent as a viable form of user input for mobile devices. High quality voice recognition can be implemented via server-side processing, but in-device recognition is a bigger challenge. This project would be to develop a high-quality voice recognition system that can run on mobile devices by exploiting parallel hardware.
 
Project 7: Static Analysis of the Browser Event Model
Doctor JS (http://doctorjs.org) is a static analysis framework for JavaScript built on an advanced abstract interpreter for the JavaScript semantics. However, the engine currently knows very little about the non-deterministic control-flow and data-flow model of browser events and user-defined event handlers. This project would be to adapt DoctorJS to understand the browser's event model.
 
Project 8: XPCOM Interface Extraction
Part of the challenge of building analysis and development tools for the browser infrastructure is the interface between JavaScript (used to implement the Firefox user interface as well as browser extensions) and C++ (used to implement the core platform). The Gecko platform uses a component model, known as XPCOM, for implementing these cross-language interfaces. Firefox uses about 1,500 distinct XPCOM interfaces -- too many to model by hand in a static analysis framework. This project would be to use C++ static analysis tools such as　Dehydra (https://developer.mozilla.org/en/Dehydra) to generate interface descriptors that could be integrated into a static analysis for JavaScript.
 
Project 9: A Rust Debugger
Rust (http://rust-lang.org) is a next-generation parallel systems language being designed and implemented at Mozilla Research. Rust's shared-nothing concurrency model should make it possible to combine traditional sequential debugging techniques (e.g., gdb) with novel concurrent debugging technology. This project would be to develop a Rust debugger.
 
Project 10: Asynchronous I/O for Rust
The libuv (https://github.com/joyent/libuv) project is developing a cross-platform systems library for asynchronous I/O. This project would be to design and implement an asynchronous I/O library and infrastructure for Rust.

fields.title: Volunteer, Add-on Reviewer

fields.title: Mobile Software Tools Developer (London 2012)
fields.description:
Mozilla's expanding into London's Covent Garden district in early 2012.  We aim to tap the rich mobile development waters off the Thames. Smaller, faster, and more purpose-driven browsers and OS's have enabled the growth of a portable and ubiquitous web. To drive this growth further and champion the Open Web, we're looking for London-based developers and staff.
 
Mozilla's automation infrastructure runs over a hundred thousand tests every day, testing everything from memory leaks to graphical layout to platform level functionality.  We are expanding that infrastructure to include the latest in static-analysis tooling and mobile operating systems while increasing robustness and making it more flexible.

As part of the Automation & Infrastructure team, you will work on the newest automation and infrastructure projects to help bring up new platforms for cloning into massively parallel automation systems.  As part of this, you will diagnose networking, battery, processor, power, display etc issues that prevent systems under test from being robust clients for test automation.  Once the device parameters have been well understood and a system has been found to keep the device operating robustly, you will turn the VM/device over to the build team for rapid cloning and insertion into the automation matrix.

When you're not working on a new platform, you'll be helping to design new automation frameworks and tools as well as writing code to help integrate those new frameworks into existing systems.  If you have an interest in working with the craziest, newest platforms, if you have an interest in writing bomb-proof code, we want to talk to you.

Our candidate will have:
* Superb python skills
* Proven work in test and/or build automation and infrastructure
* Knowledge and ability to design,  parallel, independent, database backed systems
* Experience and familiarity with mobile operating systems/constraints such as Android, Windows Mobile, and/or Maemo
* Interest in diagnosing and mitigating low-level device interaction issues
* Stellar intra- and extra-team communication skills
* 4-8 years experience

We'd also like to see:
* Buildbot or other continuous integration system experience
* JavaScript and/or C++ Experience

fields.title: College: 2012 Intern - User Experience Design
fields.description:
Firefox is used by an estimated 400+ million people as their window onto the Web, and exceeds 30% market share. What is remarkable about Firefox is not only its success, but the way a distributed global community of contributors have organized to effectively compete with corporations like Microsoft, Apple and Google.

The Firefox User Experience Team makes sure that the browser is easy to use, powerful, and keeps the user at its center — and in control of their online experience. We are a team of designers, researchers and engineers that work together to invent and deliver the next-generation browser.

Why should you consider applying for a position with the Firefox UX team?

    You want to design and ship great user experiences, and work with some of the world's most experienced and talented designers.
    You get to ship your designs to half a billion people — every six weeks.
    You can design with no concern for revenue or business plans — and build the best possible interface with no artificial limitations.
    You will work with engineers that are extremely passionate about user experience.
    You get to share your work with the world *as you create it* — there are no secrets at Mozilla.
    You will defend and protect the open web, and be a force for good — and go up against some of the biggest companies in the world to make it happen.

Do you think you've got what it takes to change the world on a regular basis? Bring your secret superpowers, and join us!

fields.title: Systems Administrator
fields.location: Mountain View (Remote Possible), CA, United States
fields.description:
Think you can handle root@mozilla? Know your way around Linux better than your own house? Is it your mission to build the biggest and best performing systems in the world?
 
Mozilla's looking for a well-seasoned systems administrator. You'll need a strong mastery of Linux and various web application stacks (LAMP, python, postgres, etc) - all at extreme scale. You'll be expected to provide hands-on technical engineering and ownership of our ever-growing server and application environments across multiple global datacenters.
 
Most importantly, you'll be managing the infrastructure responsible for serving over 400 million Firefox users.
 
Responsibilities:
* Maintenance of our core server infrastructure, including network and physical layout, design, and the integration required to scale our web services from tens to hundreds of millions of clients
* Support and maintenance of our Red Hat Enterprise Linux server environment including deployment, patch management, and troubleshooting
* Write, maintain, and expand automation tools for our LDAP authentication system

* Experience supporting large scale, public-facing mission-critical LAMP infrastructure
* Strong scripting knowledge (perl/python/shell)

* Must be able to troubleshoot complex issues quickly and effectively
* Strong Knowledge of DHCP, DNS, LDAP, NFS
* Knowledge of various storage appliances (NetApp, Equalogic, etc)
* Affinity for open environments that encourage education, cooperation and teamwork
* Abilty to mentor other members of the team
* Exceptional communication, organization and leadership skills

fields.title: College: 2012 Intern - Software Engineering (Front-end)
fields.description:
Help us build Firefox! The Firefox team is the engineering group responsible for putting an intuitive, performant, and delightful user interface on top of the Gecko rendering engine. Our interns hack directly on user-facing features, working with other engineers as well as designers and user experience professionals to help Firefox serve its users better.

Our interns have built new UI features from scratch (like about:permissions), have built frameworks to support whole classes of tools (like source map support for our developer tools), and have precision-tuned and optimized our existing features (like our phishing/malware databases).

If you want to make the web a better place, if you understand why that experience starts with the pixels on the users screen, and if you have the chops to make it all better: we want to talk to you. For updates on current projects, check out Planet Firefox -- http://planet.firefox.com/

* Through understanding of web standards including HTML, CSS, and XML.
* Design sense for developing intuitive user interfaces.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to quickly learn and be effective with a large code base.
* Experience participating in and contributing to open source projects a plus.

fields.title: Front-End, Boot to Gecko
fields.description:
Phones and tablets built around the Open Web are a new frontier that's barely been explored.  You will hop on Mozilla's wagon and help us chart the way that millions of people will interact with their phones and tablets, through HTML5 user interfaces and applications.  The ideal candidate groks the Web principles of users first, elegant abstraction, deep customization, hyperlinked ecosystem, the Web-at-your-fingertips through URLs, and is eager to apply them to the device space.  Like pioneers on other frontiers, though, we'll rough it at times: we'll be living on the bleeding edge where APIs break and evolve continuously, and we'll need to get code out early and often.  In exchange, we have the opportunity to see our design DNA improve the devices millions of people use around the world.

The candidate will join our Boot2Gecko team and help create a complete, standalone operating system built on the Open Web.  The candidate will want to ship world-class software early and often, and will be ruthless in prioritizing work and doing whatever is necessary to ship.

Responsibilities
* Design and implement "Web homescreens", "cloud desktops": the core interface of devices

* Design and implement core services, like software keyboards, in HTML5
* Help iterate on the design of new device APIs
* Work with partners to customize user experiences
* Analyze and optimize the performance of HTML5 applications

Requirements
* BS or MS in Computer Science (or equivalent experience) +1 year professional software development experience
* Strong fundamentals in the development of complex software applications for the Web
* Thorough understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, and JavaScript)
* Experience with mobile-device user interfaces, applications, and hardware (sensors, vibrators, etc.) a big plus

fields.title: College: 2012 Intern - Metrics (Data Analysis)

Our Metrics Intern will be responsible for developing, extending, and maintaining the systems for business users interact with it to visualize data and measure the success of goals.  Expertise with data visualization, metrics generation, reporting and databases is desired. The ideal candidate would have a passion for providing the best possible data analysis tools to business users, and an interest in deriving insights from raw data.

fields.title: Security Engineer
fields.description:
We're looking for an exceptional Security Engineer to be part of the Security Team whose sole mission is to make sure Mozilla's environment is secure and safe for 450+ million users. Our gear serves updates, products, add-ons and services to over ~25% of the web and with that high profile comes constant risk of malicious attacks. This position will coordinate between many aspects of security with a focus on vulnerability management, incident response, and event aggregation and correlation.   This individual will be a highly motivated security professional who will have strong communication skills and a fondness for breaking things.
 
Responsibilities:
* Work with other teams to develop the security roadmap that covers the infrastructure including the workstations, network, servers and applications
* Assess the security of the core infrastructure and take hands on role in building solutions
* Define configuration standards for system and network devices to harden them against attacks
* Consult on new infrastructure projects or architecture changes and evaluate security needs
* Support the Security Operations team by designing and implementing infrastructure to aid incident response efforts
* Design and implement infrastructure to protect the Mozilla network.
* Conduct sophisticated security reviews of core infrastructure
* Perform black box testing on applications, systems and networks
* Configure and harden Network and LAMP Installations
* Be a subject matter expert for “Secure Architecture Design and Implementation Practices”
* Develop automation and processes to identify security flaws in code
* Participate in architectural and design discussions
* Manage wide scale penetration and vulnerability scans company wide

* BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
* Strong general security background
* Experience with networking, cryptography, PKI, authentication systems and logging infrastructure
* Ability to see the big picture and provide security subject-matter expertise
* Knowledge of network-based and system-level attacks and mitigation methods
* Knowledge of system-level attacks and mitigation methods with a core competency in Linux or Mac OS X.
* Have experience with packet capturers
* Be experienced with reviewing code and performing web application black box testing according to OWASP Top 10BA/BS in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience
* Good knowledge of a variety of standard UNIX/Linux services (Apache, MySQL, Nagios)
* Competency in two or more scripting languages, in example Shell, PHP, Perl or Python for automation is required.
* Solid understanding of web services architecture and commonly employed technologies

  • Work with various project specialists to develop a strong web development curriculum for  various projects and programs within Mozilla, including Hackasaurus and School of Webcraft

fields.title: College: 2012 Intern - Security Engineering
fields.description:
Product Security:

The Product Security Team at Mozilla is responsible for hardening Mozilla products against attacks and keeping our users safe while browsing the Web. This includes finding and fixing vulnerabilities in our code, implementing features that make it easier to stay safe online, and producing regular and timely security updates to our products.

Projects from past interns include implementing CSRF protection for users on private internal networks, or even implementing a mechanism to do site validation using the DNSSEC protocol inside the TLS handshake.
You can find further information about our team and projects here:
https://blog.mozilla.com/security/
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Roadmap

Requirements:
* Enrollment in BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
* Demonstrated experience with finding common web site security issues (XSS, CSRF, session fixation, SQL injection, information leakage, etc.)
* Low level software security testing skills, including finding memory safety issues, local escalation of privilege (file/service/socket permissions), or other exploits around subverting internal software security boundaries
* Track record (i.e. published advisories) for having found issues in popular browsers, desktop software packages, or major websites desirable
* Working knowledge of crypto (SSL certificates, code signing symmetric crypto) desirable
* Understanding of low-level OS security mechanisms for the purpose of designing applications with multi-process, multi-privilege architectures a bonus
* Ability to work well with others a necessity; Mozilla is an open and collaborative environment


Privacy Engineering Team:
The Privacy Engineering Team at Mozilla is responsible for building features into Mozilla products and the Web to give people better control over how their data is disclosed, shared and used online.  This includes efforts like Do-Not-Track, Cookie Management, Privacy Enhancing Technology development, and aiding other groups so they can build privacy into all our products.
 
A Privacy Engineering Intern would work on building something that helps people understand how their data is used or give them control over it. An example project would be building a site-relationship visualization tool (http://collusion.toolness.org) that shows the user how their information is shared online.
 
https://blog.mozilla.com/privacy/ (both engineering and operational privacy)
https://blog.sidstamm.com/ (my blog, mostly privacy)
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Privacy/Roadmap
 
Requirements:
 
* Enrollment in BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
* Demonstrated experience with common web and network security and privacy issues  (XSS, CSRF, SQL injection, information leakage, MITM, data inference attacks)
* Working knowledge of crypto (SSL certificates, code signing, symmetric crypto) desirable
* Understanding of web technologies (cookies, HTML5, etc) an absolute must.
* Track record (i.e. published work or released products) involving privacy enhancing technologies desirable
